required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: MemoryGel Silicone Gel-Filled Breast Implant Post-Approval Study

brief_summary.textblock: In November 2006, U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approved Mentor's MemoryGel silicone gel-filled breast implants for use in women who are undergoing primary or revisional breast augmentation and primary or revisional breast reconstruction surgery. This postapproval study is intended to satisfy one element of FDA's postapproval monitoring requirements. In January 2015, the FDA approved a protocol amendment that limits the scope of data collection for the study to the collection of only secondary procedure/reoperation data for MemoryGel participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Kaplan-Meier Estimated Cumulative Incidence Rate of Breast Surgery Reoperations
primary_outcome.description: The cumulative incidences of reoperations through 10 years for women with MemoryGel breast implants will be estimated based on surgeon reporting using Kaplan-Meier methodology

primary_outcome.measure: Kaplan-Meier Estimated Cumulative Incidence Rate of Breast Implant Explantations
primary_outcome.description: The cumulative incidences of explantations through 10 years for women with MemoryGel breast implants will be estimated based on surgeon reporting using Kaplan-Meier methodology

secondary_outcome.description: Frequencies of the reason for reoperation will be computed for women with MemoryGel breast implants through 10 years

arm_group.description: MemoryGel Breast Implant Participants received Mentor Silicone Gel-Filled Breast Implants (MemoryGel) during their Breast Augmentation, Breast Reconstruction, or Revision surgery
Saline Breast Implant Control Participants received Saline Filled Breast Implants during their Breast Augmentation, Breast Reconstruction, or Revision surgery

study_pop.textblock: MemoryGelâ„¢ PAS uses a current cohort design of 41,900 gel participants and 1,000 saline participants.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Female, age 18 years or older (22 or older for breast augmentation patients)
2. U.S. resident
Exclusion Criteria:
1. If a saline participant, current or past, unilateral or bilateral, silicone breast implants
2. Active infection anywhere in her body
3. Existing breast cancer or pre-cancer of the breast without adequate treatment for those conditions
4. Currently pregnant or nursing
